channel.title: Fairness on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in Fairness on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: A Closer Look at AUROC and AUPRC under Class Imbalance
item.description: Debunking a common myth, this paper proves that AUPRC is not superior to AUROC for imbalanced datasets, and in fact, can worsen algorithmic bias.

item.title: A Simple Remedy for Dataset Bias via Self-Influence: A Mislabeled Sample Perspective
item.description: This paper introduces Bias-Conditioned Self-Influence (BCSI) for precise bias-conflicting sample detection and model rectification, enhancing fairness in machine learning.

item.title: A Unifying Post-Processing Framework for Multi-Objective Learn-to-Defer Problems
item.description: A novel post-processing framework, based on a d-dimensional generalization of the Neyman-Pearson lemma, optimally solves multi-objective learn-to-defer problems under various constraints, improving co…

item.title: Achievable Fairness on Your Data With Utility Guarantees
item.description: This paper introduces a computationally efficient method to approximate the optimal accuracy-fairness trade-off curve for various datasets, providing rigorous statistical guarantees and quantifying un…

item.title: Are Your Models Still Fair? Fairness Attacks on Graph Neural Networks via Node Injections
item.description: Node Injection-based Fairness Attack (NIFA) reveals GNNs’ vulnerability to realistic fairness attacks by injecting a small percentage of nodes, significantly undermining fairness even in fairness-awar…

item.title: Automating Data Annotation under Strategic Human Agents: Risks and Potential Solutions
item.description: AI models retraining with model-annotated data incorporating human strategic responses can lead to unexpected outcomes, potentially reducing the proportion of agents with positive labels over time, wh…

item.title: Bias in Motion: Theoretical Insights into the Dynamics of Bias in SGD Training
item.description: AI systems acquire bias during training, impacting accuracy across sub-populations. This research unveils bias’s dynamic nature, revealing how classifier preferences shift over time, influenced by dat…

item.title: Building a stable classifier with the inflated argmax
item.description: Boost classifier stability with the novel inflated argmax, guaranteeing reliable multiclass classification without distributional assumptions!

item.title: Conformal Classification with Equalized Coverage for Adaptively Selected Groups
item.description: This paper introduces AFCP, a novel conformal inference method that generates prediction sets with valid coverage conditional on adaptively selected features, achieving a practical balance between eff…

item.title: Counterfactual Fairness by Combining Factual and Counterfactual Predictions
item.description: This paper proposes a novel method to achieve optimal counterfactual fairness in machine learning models while minimizing predictive performance degradation.

item.title: DeNetDM: Debiasing by Network Depth Modulation
item.description: DeNetDM uses network depth modulation to automatically debiase image classifiers without bias annotations or data augmentation, improving accuracy by 5%.

item.title: Dueling over Dessert, Mastering the Art of Repeated Cake Cutting
item.description: Repeated cake-cutting game reveals that strategic players can exploit myopic opponents, but equitable outcomes are achievable through specific strategies.

item.title: Enhancing Robustness of Last Layer Two-Stage Fair Model Corrections
item.description: Boosting fair machine learning’s robustness against noisy labels, this work introduces a novel label-spreading method, achieving state-of-the-art worst-group accuracy.

item.title: Fair Allocation in Dynamic Mechanism Design
item.description: This paper presents optimal fair mechanisms for dynamic auction design, maximizing seller revenue while guaranteeing minimum allocations to multiple buyer groups.

item.title: Fair and Welfare-Efficient Constrained Multi-Matchings under Uncertainty
item.description: This paper presents novel, scalable algorithms for fair and efficient constrained resource allocation under uncertainty using robust and CVaR optimization.

item.title: Fair Bilevel Neural Network (FairBiNN): On Balancing fairness and accuracy via Stackelberg Equilibrium
item.description: FairBiNN, a novel bilevel neural network, achieves Pareto optimal solutions by simultaneously optimizing for accuracy and fairness, outperforming existing methods.

item.title: Fair GLASSO: Estimating Fair Graphical Models with Unbiased Statistical Behavior
item.description: Fair GLASSO ensures fair Gaussian graphical models by introducing novel bias metrics and a penalized maximum likelihood estimator to mitigate group biases in data.

item.title: Fair Online Bilateral Trade
item.description: This paper proposes a novel online bilateral trading algorithm maximizing the fair gain from trade and provides tight regret bounds under various settings.

item.title: Fair Secretaries with Unfair Predictions
item.description: Fair algorithms can leverage biased predictions to improve performance while guaranteeing fairness for all candidates.

item.title: Fair Wasserstein Coresets
item.description: Fair Wasserstein Coresets (FWC) efficiently generates fair, representative subsets of large datasets for downstream machine learning tasks, improving fairness and utility.

item.title: Fairness and Efficiency in Online Class Matching
item.description: First non-wasteful algorithm achieving 1/2-approximation for class envy-freeness, class proportionality, and utilitarian social welfare in online class matching.

item.title: Fairness in Social Influence Maximization via Optimal Transport
item.description: Fairness in social influence maximization is achieved via optimal transport, optimizing both outreach and a new ‘mutual fairness’ metric that considers variability in outreach scenarios.

item.title: Fairness without Harm: An Influence-Guided Active Sampling Approach
item.description: FairnessWithoutHarm achieves fairer ML models without sacrificing accuracy by using an influence-guided active sampling method that doesn’t require sensitive training data.

item.title: Fairness-Aware Estimation of Graphical Models
item.description: Fairness-aware estimation of graphical models (GMs) tackles bias in GM estimations by integrating graph disparity error and a tailored loss function into multi-objective optimization, effectively miti…

item.title: FairWire: Fair Graph Generation
item.description: FairWire tackles structural bias in graph machine learning, proposing a novel fairness regularizer and a fair graph generation framework for unbiased link prediction and graph generation.

item.title: Group-wise oracle-efficient algorithms for online multi-group learning
item.description: Oracle-efficient algorithms conquer online multi-group learning, achieving sublinear regret even with massive, overlapping groups, paving the way for fair and efficient large-scale online systems.

item.title: Honor Among Bandits: No-Regret Learning for Online Fair Division
item.description: Online fair division algorithm achieves Õ(T²/³) regret while guaranteeing envy-freeness or proportionality in expectation, a result proven tight.

item.title: Interpolating Item and User Fairness in Multi-Sided Recommendations
item.description: Problem (FAIR) framework and FORM algorithm achieve flexible multi-stakeholder fairness in online recommendation systems, balancing platform revenue with user and item fairness.

item.title: Localized Adaptive Risk Control
item.description: Localized Adaptive Risk Control (L-ARC) improves fairness and reliability of online prediction by providing localized statistical risk guarantees, surpassing existing methods in high-stakes applicatio…

item.title: Mind the Gap: A Causal Perspective on Bias Amplification in Prediction & Decision-Making
item.description: AI bias amplification in decision-making is uncovered, showing how fair prediction scores can become discriminatory after thresholding, urging stronger regulatory oversight.

item.title: Mind the Graph When Balancing Data for Fairness or Robustness
item.description: Data balancing in machine learning can hurt fairness and robustness; this paper reveals when and why, offering solutions for safer AI.

item.title: Mitigating Spurious Correlations via Disagreement Probability
item.description: DPR, a novel bias mitigation method, robustly improves model performance by leveraging disagreement probability without needing bias labels, achieving state-of-the-art results.

item.title: Monoculture in Matching Markets
item.description: Algorithmic monoculture harms applicant selection and market efficiency; this paper introduces a model to analyze its effects in two-sided matching markets.

item.title: Multi-Group Proportional Representation in Retrieval
item.description: Multi-group Proportional Representation (MPR) tackles skewed search results by measuring representation across intersectional groups, improving fairness in image retrieval.

item.title: No-Regret Learning for Fair Multi-Agent Social Welfare Optimization
item.description: This paper solves the open problem of achieving no-regret learning in online multi-agent Nash social welfare maximization.

item.title: On Socially Fair Low-Rank Approximation and Column Subset Selection
item.description: This paper reveals the surprising computational hardness of achieving fairness in low-rank approximation while offering efficient approximation algorithms.

item.title: OxonFair: A Flexible Toolkit for Algorithmic Fairness
item.description: OxonFair: a new open-source toolkit for enforcing fairness in binary classification, supporting NLP, Computer Vision, and tabular data, optimizing any fairness metric, and minimizing performance degra…

item.title: Parameterized Approximation Schemes for Fair-Range Clustering
item.description: First parameterized approximation schemes for fair-range k-median & k-means in Euclidean spaces are presented, offering faster (1+ε)-approximation algorithms.

item.title: Plant-and-Steal: Truthful Fair Allocations via Predictions
item.description: Learning-augmented mechanisms for fair allocation achieve constant-factor approximation with accurate predictions and near-optimal approximation even with inaccurate ones.

item.title: Policy Aggregation
item.description: This paper introduces efficient algorithms that leverage social choice theory to aggregate multiple individual preferences, resulting in a desirable collective AI policy.

item.title: Promoting Fairness Among Dynamic Agents in Online-Matching Markets under Known Stationary Arrival Distributions
item.description: This paper presents novel algorithms for online matching markets that prioritize fairness among dynamic agents, achieving asymptotic optimality in various scenarios and offering extensions to group-le…

item.title: Proportional Fairness in Clustering: A Social Choice Perspective
item.description: This paper reveals the surprising connection between individual and proportional fairness in clustering, showing that any approximation to one directly implies an approximation to the other, enabling …

item.title: Proportional Fairness in Non-Centroid Clustering
item.description: This paper introduces proportionally fair non-centroid clustering, achieving fairness guarantees via novel algorithms and auditing methods, demonstrating significant improvements over traditional meth…

item.title: RashomonGB: Analyzing the Rashomon Effect and Mitigating Predictive Multiplicity in Gradient Boosting
item.description: RashomonGB tackles predictive multiplicity in gradient boosting by introducing a novel inference technique to efficiently identify and mitigate conflicting model predictions, improving model selection…

item.title: Regression under demographic parity constraints via unlabeled post-processing
item.description: Ensuring fair regression predictions without using sensitive attributes? This paper presents a novel post-processing algorithm, achieving demographic parity with strong theoretical guarantees and comp…

item.title: SureMap: Simultaneous mean estimation for single-task and multi-task disaggregated evaluation
item.description: SureMap, a new method, significantly boosts accuracy in single and multi-task disaggregated evaluations of AI models using limited data by transforming the problem into Gaussian mean estimation and cl…

item.title: The Fairness-Quality Tradeoff in Clustering
item.description: Novel algorithms trace the optimal balance between clustering quality and fairness, revealing all non-dominated solutions for various objectives.

item.title: The Group Robustness is in the Details: Revisiting Finetuning under Spurious Correlations
item.description: Finetuning’s impact on worst-group accuracy is surprisingly nuanced, with common class-balancing methods sometimes hurting performance; a novel mixture method consistently outperforms others.

item.title: Theoretical and Empirical Insights into the Origins of Degree Bias in Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Researchers unveil the origins of degree bias in Graph Neural Networks (GNNs), proving high-degree nodes’ lower misclassification probability and proposing methods to alleviate this bias for fairer GN…

item.title: Towards Harmless Rawlsian Fairness Regardless of Demographic Prior
item.description: VFair achieves harmless Rawlsian fairness in regression tasks without relying on sensitive demographic data by minimizing the variance of training losses.

item.title: User-item fairness tradeoffs in recommendations
item.description: Recommendation systems must balance user satisfaction with fair item exposure. This research provides a theoretical model and empirical validation showing that user preference diversity can significan…

item.title: Wasserstein Distributionally Robust Optimization through the Lens of Structural Causal Models and Individual Fairness
item.description: This paper introduces Causally Fair DRO, a novel framework for robust optimization that addresses individual fairness concerns by incorporating causal structures and sensitive attributes, providing th…

item.title: When is Multicalibration Post-Processing Necessary?
item.description: Multicalibration post-processing isn’t always necessary; models often implicitly achieve it, especially calibrated ones. For uncalibrated models, though, it significantly improves fairness.
